Community Engagement 















 

Visitor Information Services





Welcome to the Farm
Stanford University is a place where pioneering spirit meets 21st-century possibility.




AnnouncementsTrying to plan a February visit during your Student's break? (Posted 2/8/2023)Registration for all guided campus tours and admission information sessions from Friday, February 17 through Sunday, February 26 filled up very quickly. But don't let that keep you from visiting!See detailsMany schools across the country take a week or more off surrounding the Presidents' Day holiday. This is often referred to as "Ski Week" and is a popular time for high school students to visit campuses -- second only to Spring Break in terms of visitor volume. 

That being said, the Stanford Visitor Center, a division of Stanford's Office of Undergraduate Admission, will be open from Tuesday, February 21 through Friday, February 24 (closed Monday, February 20) to greet and assist all of you who would still like to visit campus, interact with students, and get information about applying to Stanford's undergraduate class.

While tours and information sessions are at capacity (and we do not offer waiting lists), no registration is required to participate in our very popular  Student Forum  and the concurrent "Parent/Supporter Q&A" sessions taking place each day from 12:00 - 1:00pm at the Visitor Center. These are unique and valuable opportunities to interact with students and staff to find out more about what it's like to be a Stanford undergraduate and what the process looks like to become one!

Our staff will also be available to help provide information on how to tour the campus on your own, whether navigating via our self-guided tour map or any of the many resources available under the "Explore Campus" tab on the Stanford visitor website at:  visit.stanford.edu/explore-campus.

For more information, call the Stanford Visitor Center during business hours (9:00am - 5:00pm weekdays, excluding holidays) at (650) 723-2560.
Spring and Summer tour and program registration (Updated 2/13/2023)Initial registration for prospective undergraduate tours and programs being offered for Stanford's Spring Quarter (program dates: April 3 - June 2) was posted for registration on Monday, February 13. Initial registration for tours and programs for summer will be posted and go live at 12:00pm noon on Monday, May 8.See detailsRegistration for all tours and programs is located on the Stanford Undergraduate Admission website (admission.stanford.edu/engage).
Tours for Approved Groups/Organizations available by reservation (Updated 2/8/2023)Guided tours of campus for groups of prospective undergraduate students (schools, organizations, etc.) are available to approved groups by advance reservation on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays during the academic quarter.See detailsThe Office of Undergraduate Admission is pleased to announce that 45-minute tours are once again provided by advance reservation to qualifying organizations, with tours given during Winter Quarter at 11:15am and 1:15pm on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays from January 24 through March 16. Please note that at this point,  no Group Tours will be available during the period from March 17 through May 1. Group Tours for Spring Quarter will resume Tuesday, May 2 and continue through Thursday, June 2. Summer availability has not yet been determined.

At this point, all new Group Tour requests should be sent to grouptours@stanford.edu. Requests that have already been submitted for fall and beyond will be reviewed and receive responses based upon tour availability and qualifying status.
Qualifying organizations: The Office of Undergraduate Admission seasonally offers guided tours by appointment for prospective undergraduate student groups of 10 or more people (up to 100 max) from the following categories:

High Schools
Community Colleges
Not-For-Profit Organizations focused on Access or Exposure to College
Qualifying Community Based Organizations

Other groups: Middle schools, grade schools, and other qualifying organizations may request approval to visit and park on campus, and can be provided with resources to enjoy a self-guided visit with age appropriate sites, resources, and activities, but we are sorry to say that we are no longer providing staffing for guided tours for these age levels.
Please note that we will not grant requests for group visits through commercial or third party tour operators. All requests and communications must come from and and be processed through a qualifying organization.
